snippet: The vote was boycotted by a third of the members of the main rebel coalition, a reflection of the intense divisions among those seeking to overthrow President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: National Coalition for Syrian Revolutionary and Opposition Forces votes to send delegation to international peace conference aimed at ending Syria's civil war; some members who boycott vote say they did so because they do not believe it had enough support from rebels inside Syria.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Silivri, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The vote was boycotted by a third of the members of the main rebel coalition, a reflection of the intense divisions among those seeking to overthrow President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.main: Syrian Opposition Votes to Attend Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition Votes to Attend Peace Talks
